content: Ping Yang's home page Ping Yang Professor, Associate Director for Research and Graduate Programs, School of Computing Director, Center for Information Assurance and Cybersecurity Ph.D., Stony Brook University (SUNY) P-11, Engineering Building Thomas J. Watson College of Engineering and Applied Science Binghamton University (SUNY) Email: pyang[at]binghamton[dot]edu Office Phone:607-777-5697 [Research] | [Publications] | [Teaching] | [Students] Research My research interests lie in the areas of Information and Systems Security, Privacy, AI-based Security, Trustworthy AI, Virtual Machine Security, and Access Control. I am the director of the Center for Information Assurance and Cybersecurity, and the coordinator of BSCS cybersecurity track, MSCS cybersecurity track, and Advanced Certificate in Cybersecurity Program. Current Research Projects AI-based Security and Trustworthy AI Security in Virtualized Cloud Computing Infrastructures NSF Scholarship for Service GenCyber Teacher Program Past Research Projects Scientific Workflow Security Analysis of Trust Management Policies Ad Hoc Bridging Protocol Verification Techniques for Mobile Systems and Security Protocols Publications List of Publications Teaching CS458/CS558 Introduction to Computer Security (Fall 2024) CS571 Programming Languages (Fall 2021) CS680H Blockchain Technology and Its Applications (Fall 2019) Prospective Students: If you are interested in working in our group, please email me your resume and a copy of your graduate/undergraduate transcript. Contact: pyang [at] binghamton [dot] edu
